name: Ono Kai
address: 8459 Basement 1, Connector Hostel, Kalayaan Avenue, Corner Don Pedro, Makati City
description: Great ambience – lowkey and tasteful lounge vibes. Solid food and good music when the function begins after dinner.

name: Just Thai
address: Molito - Alabang
description: Highly satisfying Thai flavors but mainstream. Their space in Molito is okay. A bit pricey.

name: Bamba
address: 57 Aguirre Ave, Parañaque
description: Very good and inventive dishes – on the pricier side. Pretty good ambience.

name: Aya
address: The Balmori Suites, Hidalgo Dr, Rockwell Center, Makati City
description: A modern take on Filipino interiors. Great hearty food with a touch of class and a story.

name: Mangiamo
address: Sedeño cor Valero Street, Salcedo Village, Makati City
description: Cozy, like dining at your Italian grandmother’s home. Authentic and consistently great food.

name: Fresca Trattoria
address: G/F, The Grand Midori, Bolanos, Legazpi Village, Makati City
description: Modern but authentic Italian restaurant. Favorites include Uni pasta and homemade tiramisu.

name: Chingolo
address: Molito Lifestyle Center, Ayala Alabang, Muntinlupa City
description: A deli, restaurant and bar with great steaks, cocktails, and ambiance.

name: Pablo
address: Salcedo Village, G/F The Picasso Boutique Residences, Makati City
description: Neighborhood Spanish bistro with hearty food and very friendly staff.

name: Offbeat
address: 2F Ayala Triangle Gardens Tower 2, Makati City
description: Playful twists on Filipino food and drinks. Must-try spot in Makati.

name: Kong Noodles
address: Ayala Triangle Gardens, Makati City
description: Innovative take on Asian noodles with bold flavors.

name: Tsumura
address: 3F Ayala Triangle Gardens Tower 2, Makati City
description: Top Japanese restaurant known for clean, elevated, authentic dishes.

name: Miyazaki
address: Molito Lifestyle Center, Alabang
description: Crowd favorite with high-quality sushi and memorable flavors.

name: Canton Road
address: Level 3, Shangri-La at the Fort, Taguig City
description: Traditional and innovative Chinese cuisine with superb service.

address: 8 Rockwell Dr, Makati City
description: Experimental Japanese cuisine mixing modern and traditional flavors.

name: Automat
address: Building A, 2F, 2316 Chino Roces Ave, Makati City
description: Modern Filipino cuisine with warm hospitality.

name: Gallery by Chele
address: 5/F Clipp Center, BGC, Taguig
description: Great for dates. Amazing course meals without needing alcohol pairings.

name: Bombvinos
address: Unit 3, Zone Sports Center, 7224 Malugay Street, Makati City
description: Innovative Filipino dishes. Surprisingly underrated spot.

name: Tsokolateria-Pamana
address: Greenhills Shopping Center, San Juan City
description: Homey, nostalgic Filipino meals like your grandmother used to cook.

name: Nikkei Nama Bar
address: One Bonifacio High Street Mall, BGC
description: Japanese–Latin fusion with great cocktails and sushi.

name: El Born
address: 2/F Mitsukoshi BGC
description: Home of Manila’s best cheesecake. Gooey, cheesy perfection.

name: Uma Nota
address: Shangri-La The Fort, BGC
description: Perfect for celebrations. Great food, drinks, and ambiance.

name: Cibo
address: UP Town Center, Quezon City
description: Iconic Italian chain loved for consistently delicious dishes.

name: Tori Tori Kushiyaki
address: 197 Wilson, San Juan City
description: Best izakaya in San Juan. Amazing sushi and rice meals.

name: Kong
address: Ayala Triangle Gardens, Makati City
description: Delicious Asian noodles and standout green curry.
